result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin A Kertz

records.addlTxt: FOP/DPU Contract rec'd; Contract terminates on 7/23/23

1:31 PM Defendant Justin A Kertz in court with Attorney Eric P Habich.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Signed.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty.  Court accepted defendant's plea but withheld adjudication and referred defendant to the Dane County Deferred Prosecution Program.  Bail continued. 

Abby H.
ADA Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State. Attorney Eric P. Habich appeared in person with Defn. Plea scheduled, NIH.
Plea hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lindsay P or Joseph W. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

11:06 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Aaron L. Abram.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
